instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.3V42_G3H: What is 3V42_G3H? This is shorthand for PP3V42_G3H which is one of the first power rails that must turn on in older Macbooks that use a magsafe charger in order for them to get a light on the charger. This power rail powers the onewire circuit and the SMC, which are necessary for the machine to communicate with the charger and get it to turn on, as well as begin the bootup sequence. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.U5000: What is U5000? This is the System Management Controller(SMC) in macbooks from 2013-2015.
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA: What is SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA? SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA is the data line of an I2C data line between the battery charging chip that creates PPBUS_G3H, the system management controller(SMC), the battery, and the battery indicator LED. If this line’s resistance to ground is too low because of a defective component, battery will not be recognized with an X on the icon and PPBUS_G3H voltage will be lower than it is on a good system..
definitions.SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL: What is SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL? SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL is the clock line of an I2C data line between the battery charging chip that creates PPBUS_G3H, the system management controller(SMC), the battery, and the battery indicator LED. If this line’s resistance to ground is too low because of a defective component, battery will not be recognized with an X on the icon and PPBUS_G3H voltage will be lower than it is on a good system..
definitions.SMBUS_SMC_0_S0_SCL: What is SMBUS_SMC_0_S0_SCL? SMBUS_SMC_0_S0_SCL is a clock line on the data line between the system management controller(SMC), temperature sensors, GPU, and ALS(ambient light sensor). If this line is pulled down the machine may run slow or have the fans run fast all the time because the SMC can’t tell what the temperature of parts of the machine like fin stack are. Usual problem is bad webcam, unplug webcam to see if it fixes problem. .
definitions.SMBUS_SMC_0_S0_SDA: What is SMBUS_SMC_0_S0_SDA? SMBUS_SMC_0_S0_SDA is a data line between the system management controller(SMC), temperature sensors, GPU, and ALS(ambient light sensor). If this line is pulled down the machine may run slow or have the fans run fast all the time because the SMC can’t tell what the temperature of parts of the machine like fin stack are. Usual problem is bad webcam, unplug webcam to see if it fixes problem. .
definitions.SMBUS_SMC_3_SCL: What is SMBUS_SMC_3_SCL? SMBUS_SMC_3_SCL is the clock line in the SMBUS data line between the trackpad temperature sensor, temperature sensors, and the system management controller(SMC). .
definitions.SMBUS_SMC_3_SDA: What is SMBUS_SMC_3_SDA? SMBUS_SMC_3_SDA is the SMBUS data line between the trackpad temperature sensor, temperature sensors, and the system management controller(SMC). .
definitions.I2C_CAM_SDA: What is I2C_CAM_SDA? I2C_CAM_SDA is an SMBUS data line between the webcam and the chip that controls the camera. .
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.

threads.title: 820-000165A - no light on the charger and no power
threads.message:
Hi Guys,

I’m having a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> board (820-000165A) here with no light on the charger(on DC power supply) and no power.


F7140 has 8.16V on both sides


I don´t have:

- PP5V5
- PP3V3S5
- an enable on <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> on Pin 12
- signs of liquid damage

partially green light with OEM wall charger


Any help is appreciated.

threads.title: 820-000165A - no light on the charger and no power
threads.message: Start checking <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: 820-000165A - no light on the charger and no power
threads.message:
Thank you.
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is present with 3.3V on <RESISTOR>R5100</RESISTOR> as well as <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>
Resistor has proper value as well.

threads.title: 820-000165A - no light on the charger and no power
threads.message:
Did you try known good LIO board/flex?
Disconnect LIO flex and check if <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> appears.

Missing <SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> is sign of SMC issue.
Do you get Y5110 oscillation?
Check voltages and signals for <CHIP>U5000</CHIP> (2 OF 2) at page 37.

threads.title: 820-000165A - no light on the charger and no power
threads.message:
No luck without teaching I/O cable.
Y5110 has 3,4V on Pin 3, Nothing on Pin 1.
Please feel free to check my readings attached

threads.title: 820-000165A - no light on the charger and no power
threads.message:
Looks like SMC doesn't work.
In such case you should find aprox 1.1V on both pins of Y5110.
Try changing Y5110, <RESISTOR>R5110</RESISTOR>, <CAPACITOR>C5110</CAPACITOR>/11.
If still the same, reball SMC; change it at least chance.

threads.title: 820-000165A - no light on the charger and no power
threads.message:
Thanks, just changed and rebelled, nothing different. Just ordered preprogrammed SMC from CN.
Very responsive support!!!!

threads.title: 820-000165A - no light on the charger and no power
threads.message: So I received the SMCs from China, no green then orange light, the board goes straight to 500mA and stays there, CPU is getting hot. No short in that area.

threads.title: 820-000165A - no light on the charger and no power
threads.message:
Fan spins now?
Post voltage for the coils, including CPU's ones.

threads.title: 820-000165A - no light on the charger and no power
threads.message:
Yes its spinning, and gets faster due to hot CPU.
Please take a look at the picture attached[ATTACH type="full"]59902[/ATTACH]

threads.title: 820-000165A - no light on the charger and no power
threads.message:
Did you check USB activity and external video?
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> goes high?

F7140 exact voltage, without battery?

threads.title: 820-000165A - no light on the charger and no power
threads.message:
There's USB activity, but no video output. Fan is spinning really fast.

<RESISTOR>R2071</RESISTOR>        3,3V
F7140        8,16V (with and without without battery)

threads.title: 820-000165A - no light on the charger and no power
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is incorrect.
Post voltage and diode mode to ground on SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.

Are you really sure about USB activity?
Read this thread...
[URL unfurl="true"]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/how-to-collection.60974/[/URL]

threads.title: 820-000165A - no light on the charger and no power
threads.message:
I was talking about battery bus.
Checking pins 4 & 5 of J6950 is not good enough???

As you get identical values, the SMC may not correspond to this board, or has problems.
Be sure, <RESISTOR>R7100</RESISTOR> is good and change <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>.
If still bad <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>, then get correct SMC from donor board.

"Are you really sure about USB activity?"
???

threads.title: 820-000165A - no light on the charger and no power
threads.message:
Sorry for being stupid, I'm not an expert, that's why I participated here.
I thought everything would help.
Yes I'm sure.[ATTACH type="full"]59904[/ATTACH]

Steady light on USB device doesn't confirm activity.
Did you read the above linked thread?

threads.title: 820-000165A - no light on the charger and no power
threads.message: Yes, I read and did what you wrote. No change. But please check this out. From What I thought, that the SMC is programmed, this Chinese seller doesn't confirm.[ATTACH type="full" alt="Bildschirmfoto 2021-05-31 um 12.55.30.png"]59907[/ATTACH][ATTACH]59907[/ATTACH][ATTACH]59908[/ATTACH][ATTACH]59909[/ATTACH][ATTACH]59910[/ATTACH]

threads.title: 820-000165A - no light on the charger and no power
threads.message:
"Yes, I read and did what you wrote."
So you can confirm 100% USB activity, as explained on that thread???

The seller showed SMC on cuted boards, so must be already programmed.
However, I recommend to buy full scrap boards (when available).
Only few bucks more and you will get a lot of MOSFETs, ICs and passive components too.
And of course, you can be sure the SMC is from the board model you need.

I never got bad SMC from China, but is good to suppose a 5% failing rate; buy more than one board, is better.

threads.title: 820-000165A - no light on the charger and no power
threads.message:
So I received the board with the SMC and placed on mine. The board has now 8,5V on F7140.
But still not turning on. Stuck still at 500mA and not charging. SMC reset did work by shorting with tweezers, but didn't make any difference. Under thermal I saw <CHIP>U4500</CHIP> getting warmest as well as the CPU

threads.title: 820-000165A - no light on the charger and no power
threads.message:
Don't make confusion between turning on and booting.
If CPU and other chips get hot, board should turn on; not booting, of course.

So, tell us which big coils get voltage?

820-000165A - no light on the charger and no power
threads.message:
OK, so you get even VCORE.
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> goes high?

And please, confirm if you have or not USB activity!!!
Use a pendrive, as in mentioned thread.

threads.title: 820-000165A - no light on the charger and no power
threads.message: Last steps were: replaced the SMC from matching board, no change. replaced <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> and got proper PPBUS. Plugged EL Capitan stick in and got an image. All working well now. I was to worried about stuck amperage. The SMC I took off bubbled so was faulty from the beginning
